message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with matrix approximation and sampling, which are common topics in machine learning and data science. The use of leverage scores is a technique often used in low-rank matrix approximation, which falls under the category of linear algebra and numerical analysis. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also discusses the power-law decay of leverage scores, which is a topic in network science and information theory, making cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) likely sub-categories as well. Finally, the empirical evaluation of the proposed method involves real-world datasets, which suggests that cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) could also be a relevant sub-category.
